Dept. of Energy,</subfield><subfield code="c">2011.</subfield></datafield><datafield tag="264" ind1=" " ind2="2"><subfield code="a">Oak Ridge, Tenn. :</subfield><subfield code="b">Distributed by the Office of Scientific and Technical Information, U.S. Dept. of Energy.</subfield></datafield><datafield tag="336" ind1=" " ind2=" "><subfield code="a">text</subfield><subfield code="b">txt</subfield><subfield code="2">rdacontent</subfield></datafield><datafield tag="337" ind1=" " ind2=" "><subfield code="a">computer</subfield><subfield code="b">c</subfield><subfield code="2">rdamedia</subfield></datafield><datafield tag="338" ind1=" " ind2=" "><subfield code="a">online resource</subfield><subfield code="b">cr</subfield><subfield code="2">rdacarrier</subfield></datafield><datafield tag="500" ind1=" " ind2=" "><subfield code="a">Published through SciTech Connect.</subfield></datafield><datafield tag="500" ind1=" " ind2=" "><subfield code="a">07/05/2011.</subfield></datafield><datafield tag="500" ind1=" " ind2=" "><subfield code="a">"fermilab-pub-11-163-ppd"</subfield></datafield><datafield tag="500" ind1=" " ind2=" "><subfield code="a">"arXiv eprint number arXiv:1104.0344"</subfield></datafield><datafield tag="500" ind1=" " ind2=" "><subfield code="a">Physical Review Letters 107 2 ISSN 0031-9007 AM</subfield></datafield><datafield tag="500" ind1=" " ind2=" "><subfield code="a">Barr, G; Adamson, P; Bishai, M; Bogert, D; Blake, A; Andreopoulos, C; Backhouse, C; Auty, D J; Ayres, D S; Bock, G J; Boehnlein, D J; Harvard U., Phys. Dept.].</subfield></datafield><datafield tag="506" ind1=" " ind2="0"><subfield code="a">Free-to-read</subfield><subfield code="f">Unrestricted online access</subfield><subfield code="2">star</subfield></datafield><datafield tag="520" ind1="3" ind2=" "><subfield code="a">This letter reports the first direct observation of muon antineutrino disappearance. The MINOS experiment has taken data with an accelerator beam optimized for ν̄<sub>μ</sub> production, accumulating an exposure of 1.71 x 10<sup>20</sup> protons on target. In the Far Detector, 97 charged current ν̄<sub>μ</sub> events are observed. The no-oscillation hypothesis predicts 156 events and is excluded at 6.3σ. The best fit to oscillation yields </subfield><subfield code=" ">= (3.36<sub>-0.40</sub> <sup>+0.46</sup>(stat.) ± 0.06(syst.)) x 10<sup>-3</sup> eV<sup>2</sup>, sin<sup>2</sup>(2 θ̄) = 0.86<sub>-0.12</sub><sup>+0.11</sup> (stat.) ± 0.01(syst.). The MINOS ν<sub>μ</sub> and ν̄<sub>μ</sub> measurements are consistent at the 2.0% confidence level, assuming identical underlying oscillation parameters.</subfield></datafield><datafield tag="536" ind1=" " ind2=" "><subfield code="b">AC02-07CH11359</subfield></datafield><datafield tag="650" ind1=" " ind2="7"><subfield code="a">Physics Of Elementary Particles And Fields.</subfield><subfield "fermilab-pub-11-163-ppd" "arXiv eprint number arXiv:1104.0344" Physical Review Letters 107 2 ISSN 0031-9007 AM Barr, G; Adamson, P; Bishai, M; Bogert, D; Blake, A; Andreopoulos, C; Backhouse, C; Auty, D J; Ayres, D S; Bock, G J; Boehnlein, D J; Harvard U., Phys. Dept.]. Free-to-read Unrestricted online access star This letter reports the first direct observation of muon antineutrino disappearance. The MINOS experiment has taken data with an accelerator beam optimized for ν̄<sub>μ</sub> production, accumulating an exposure of 1.71 x 10<sup>20</sup> protons on target. In the Far Detector, 97 charged current ν̄<sub>μ</sub> events are observed. The no-oscillation hypothesis predicts 156 events and is excluded at 6.3σ. The best fit to oscillation yields  = (3.36<sub>-0.40</sub> <sup>+0.46</sup>(stat.) ± 0.06(syst.)) x 10<sup>-3</sup> eV<sup>2</sup>, sin<sup>2</sup>(2 θ̄) = 0.86<sub>-0.12</sub><sup>+0.11</sup> (stat.) ± 0.01(syst.). The MINOS ν<sub>μ</sub> and ν̄<sub>μ</sub> measurements are consistent at the 2.0% confidence level, assuming identical underlying oscillation parameters.
